intro: Amana wanzhensis, commonly known as the Wanzhen rock orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique floral structure. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are small, with a distinctive coloration that ranges from pale yellow to greenish-white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amana wanzhensis is considered a vulnerable species.
